channel.title: Serial
channel.description: Serial is a new podcast from the creators of This American Life, hosted by Sarah Koenig. Serial unfolds one story - a true story - over the course of a whole season. The show follows the plot and characters wherever they lead, through many surprising twists and turns. Sarah won't know what happens at the end of the story until she gets there, not long before you get there with her. Each week she'll bring you the latest chapter, so it's important to listen in, starting with Episode 1. New episodes are released on Thursday mornings. Serial, like This American Life, is a production of WBEZ Chicago.
channel.itunes:author: This American Life

item.title: Episode 2 - Wed Oct 29 2025
item.description:
Top Transportation and Logistics Stories for Wed Oct 29 2025 Here are the links for the stories: 5. Port of New Orleans Gains Approval for Foreign Trade Zone Expansion.
The Port of New Orleans has received approval to expand its Foreign Trade Zone, an FTZ, a development poised to boost trade and economic activity in the region. This expansion will allow more companies to benefit from reduced customs duties, and streamlined logistics processes, making the port a more attractive hub for international commerce. The move highlights ongoing efforts to strengthen U.S. port infrastructure, and enhance global supply chain competitiveness.

item.title: Episode 26 - Mon Dec 01 2025
item.description:
Top Transportation and Logistics Stories for Mon Dec 01 2025 Here are the links for the stories: Industry leaders are increasingly focusing on artificial intelligence, digitalization, and robust risk management strategies as top priorities for supply chain transformation in 2025. This emphasis stems from persistent inflation concerns, economic uncertainty, and ongoing workforce shortages. item.title: Episode 34 - Fri Dec 12 2025
item.description:
Top Transportation and Logistics Stories for Fri Dec 12 2025 Here are the links for the stories: DOT Considers Scrapping Biden-Era Road Safety Initiative.
The Department of Transportation is reportedly reviewing the future of its National Roadway Safety Strategy, a Biden-era initiative launched in January two thousand twenty-two, to reduce traffic fatalities. Despite evidence suggesting the program's success, including a fourteen point four percent drop in large truck-involved crash deaths, the Trump administration is considering axing the strategy. A decision on the initiative is expected by January two thousand twenty-six, which could significantly impact future road safety regulations, and infrastructure investment across the transportation sector. Industry stakeholders are keenly awaiting the outcome, as it may reshape the national approach to roadway safety.
---

item.title: Episode 40 - Mon Dec 22 2025
item.description:
Top Transportation and Logistics Stories for Mon Dec 22 2025 Here are the links for the stories: 5. Diginex Acquires The Remedy Project to Boost Supply Chain Compliance and ESG
Diginex Limited, a prominent provider of Sustainability RegTech solutions, has announced the acquisition of The Remedy Project, an advisory firm specializing in human rights and labor in global supply chains. This strategic move aims to create a leading supply chain compliance entity, offering end-to-end solutions for ESG compliance, due diligence, and remediation. The acquisition is driven by increasingly stringent global regulations, such as the EU's corporate sustainability due diligence directive, underscoring the growing importance of verifiable human rights processes in modern supply chain management.

item.description:
Top Transportation and Logistics Stories for Mon Dec 29 2025 Here are the links for the stories: 5. Motive Files for IPO, Signaling Next Phase of Fleet-Tech Arms Race
Motive, a leading fleet management technology provider, has reportedly filed for an initial public offering, or IPO, indicating a significant milestone in its growth trajectory. This move signals the next phase in the intensifying 'fleet-tech arms race' as companies increasingly invest in advanced solutions for trucking and logistics operations. An IPO would provide Motive with substantial capital to further innovate and expand its offerings, impacting the competitive landscape for fleet management and telematics. The filing highlights the continued importance of technology in optimizing transportation efficiency and safety.
